alert.note: Alert for Whatcom (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 4:38PM PST until December 07 at 2:04AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Nooksack River At Ferndale affecting Whatcom County. North Fork Stillaguamish River Near Arlington affecting Snohomish County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Nooksack River At North Cedarville affecting Whatcom County. Skagit River Near Concrete affecting Skagit County. Skagit River Near Mt. Vernon affecting Skagit County. .Rain will slowly taper off over night and move out of the area Wednesday. For the North West Region...including Saxon Bridge, North Cedarville, Ferndale, Burlington, Concrete, Mt. Vernon, Arlington, Jordan Rd. Bridge, Arlington...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nooksack River at Ferndale. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, the river begins overtopping its banks within the City of Ferndale flooding low-lying areas within the City and low pasture lands along the river from near Ferndale downstream to the mouth. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 19.8 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1015 PM PST.
